docs.lead_paragraph: IT sounds indispensable: long-term care insurance that covers domestic help and personal-care services so that frail elderly people can remain in their own homes. Advertisements for such policies, like the one in the August issue of Money magazine, promise ''a surprisingly affordable way to guarantee yourself access to higher-quality home care without having to rely on your life savings.''
docs.abstract: Advice on possible shortcomings in long-term care insurance that covers domestic help and personal-care services for frail elderly; such policies set strict criteria that must be met before in-home help is provided, including lengthy waiting periods, and often provide fewer hours of care than are needed; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: IT sounds indispensable: long-term care insurance that covers domestic help and personal-care services so that frail elderly people can remain in their own homes.    Advertisements for such policies, like the one in the August issue of Money...

docs.lead_paragraph: High medical costs and a corporate widened a second-quarter loss for Humana Inc., the company said yesterday. Humana, a health maintenance organization based in Louisville, Ky., that serves 3.7 million people, mostly in the South and Midwest, reported a loss of $95 million, or 58 cents a share, compared with earnings of $45 million, or 28 cents a share in the quarter a year earlier.
docs.abstract: Humana Inc reports second-quarter loss of $95 million, compared with earings of $45 million in quarter a year earlier; revenues grew by 50 percent to $1.61 billion, from $1.07 billion last year; chart (S)
